channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: French tourists didn’t believe the young guy on the subway was New York City’s new mayor, so he held up the newspaper to prove it
item.description: Zohran Mamdani also has to move to the mayor's mansion on the Upper East Side before the lease in Queens apartment ends later this month.

item.title: Nicolas Maduro rose from bus driver to president before presiding over Venezuela’s economic collapse
item.description: In 1986, Maduro traveled to Cuba for a year of ideological instruction, his only formal education after high school. He quickly became a union leader.

item.title: You probably use the same password for 30 different websites. It’s time for a passkey.
item.description: Many companies think of passkeys as just a security upgrade, but they’re really a crucial user experience initiative.

item.title: What happens next in Venezuela? The regime’s foundation remains in place even after U.S. capture of Maduro, analyst says
item.description: "So removing Maduro did not necessarily change the fundamental equation of control."

item.title: Trump has been laying the groundwork for a strike on Venezuela for a full year. Here’s the timeline
item.description: President Donald Trump had long threatened that he could order military strikes on targets on Venezuelan territory after months of attacks on boats ac...

item.title: This could be a better — and safer — way into the AI trade in 2026
Trump says U.S. has captured Venezuela's Maduro. What happens next in markets.

Why retirement investors should beware of this ‘Marie Antoinette’ market
